snippet.textDisplay: True story. This tune is so catchy that I racked up 60+ hours in the game by having it on repeat. Also by screwing around making a Steam guide with maps, but mostly to play this song. The in-game version loops better than the one from the soundtrack!
snippet.textOriginal: True story. This tune is so catchy that I racked up 60+ hours in the game by having it on repeat. Also by screwing around making a Steam guide with maps, but mostly to play this song. The in-game version loops better than the one from the soundtrack!

snippet.textDisplay:
Well you thought you knew the answers
But the colors fade away
And you try, but it all just falls apart

So just open up your window and you'll know
All the places you will go
And you'll start
Finding pieces of your broken heart

Now I don't see a reason
Why you should do this
All alone
So pull yourself together, and...

We'll find the answers
Somewhere out beyond the razor's edge
And if we falter
Get back on our feet and try again

--

Well it's all so very different
from the things we knew so well
Since the world went and left us all behind

In the pieces of your memories you'll find
Broken fragments of your mind
They align
They remind you of a better time

Now I can't see the future
So I don't know how far
We will go
But now it doesn't matter, so...

We'll keep on fighting
Though these days and nights are all the same
And maybe someday
We can find a way to win the game

We can find a way to win the game

snippet.textDisplay: Finished this in a couple sittings during my big break after I clicked a random game to install in my Steam library. The box art may make it seem like it's a SNES-style game, but it's a complete throwback to the NES in terms of gameplay, graphics and music. And a very solid one at that. The game flew under the radar, but I really enjoyed my time with its semi-open world and branching paths, obviously getting inspiration from Zelda II and other classic platformers. Recommended!
snippet.textOriginal: Finished this in a couple sittings during my big break after I clicked a random game to install in my Steam library. The box art may make it seem like it's a SNES-style game, but it's a complete throwback to the NES in terms of gameplay, graphics and music. And a very solid one at that. The game flew under the radar, but I really enjoyed my time with its semi-open world and branching paths, obviously getting inspiration from Zelda II and other classic platformers. Recommended!

snippet.textDisplay:
Congrats on 50k subscribers Supra! As others already mentioned it's well deserved!
I may be wrong about this, but due to the fact you randomly downloaded a game from the Stream library and that there have been a lot more uploads from newer games since you took your break, I've been getting the impression that you have more time to play videogames recently. Did I get a wrong impression or is that actually true?
Talking about a lot of time to spend on videogames, I'm curious: you've mentioned in your 1756th entry that Xenoblade Chronicles would be your big summer game for this year. Since you were probably really busy this summer, did you manage to play it? I'm currently doing so myself, but I'm very busy aswell so I've been playing it for almost three months now.
Thanks for taking the time to read this long comment. It ended up a lot longer than I thought  it would. Also thank you for this great list, I've been enjoying it a lot even though I usually don't comment on your uploads.

Did I get a wrong impression or is that actually true?
Talking about a lot of time to spend on videogames, I'm curious: you've mentioned in your 1756th entry that Xenoblade Chronicles would be your big summer game for this year. Since you were probably really busy this summer, did you manage to play it? I'm currently doing so myself, but I'm very busy aswell so I've been playing it for almost three months now.
Thanks for taking the time to read this long comment. It ended up a lot longer than I thought  it would. Also thank you for this great list, I've been enjoying it a lot even though I usually don't comment on your uploads.
